hero.title: Human-Centered Research Platform for Non-Material Value
hero.subtitle: Pygmalion / C.R.I.S.T.A.L.L. An accounting-learning innovation platform based on NOD principles, built for the 7th technological wave (Noonomics).

why_now.title: Why Now
points: Modern systems measure price, productivity, and efficiency.
They fail to recognize what actually sustains society.
Invisible contributions disappear.
Care remains unaccounted for.
Gratitude turns into obligation.
why_now.question: What if social infrastructure could recognize value without turning it into debt or control?

problem.title: The Problem
points: Reduce human contribution to metrics and incentives
Turn participation into obligation
Optimize behavior instead of respecting dignity
problem.conclusion: This is not a technical bug. It is a systemic limitation.

solution.title: The Solution
solution.subtitle: TIUP(h) — Human-Centered Navigation Technology
points: Does not coerce
Does not punish
Does not optimize humans as resources
solution.description: TIUP(h) helps people see the consequences of their actions while preserving freedom of choice, responsibility, and meaning.

pygmalion.title: Pygmalion — Initial NOD Environment
points: Recording conscious actions
Recognizing participation
Forming a non-material footprint

cristall.title: C.R.I.S.T.A.L.L. — Accounting Core
points: Registers acts of recognition and trust
Prohibits accumulation and speculation
Allows transfer but not storage of accounting markers
cristall.note: Accounting units cannot be accumulated — only passed on.

flower.title: Flower of Life — NOD Sphere
flower.description: An ethical and evaluative layer integrating biological, social, and cognitive dimensions of the human being.

mvp.hero_title: This is a working MVP — not a product
mvp.hero_subtitle: Pygmalion MVP is a functional prototype used for research, reflection, and pilot practices. It demonstrates how non-material human value can be recognized without money, coercion, ratings, or gamification.
mvp.hero_note: This MVP exists to be tested, discussed, and evolved — not consumed.

what_does.title: What the MVP Does
points: Record acts of conscious participation
Express and register gratitude without creating obligations
Work with non-monetary accounting markers (first contour)
Observe a non-material footprint of actions, not a score or ranking
what_does.note: There is no accumulation, no competition, and no conversion into value or status.

formats.title: Two Formats — Online & Offline

online.title: Online MVP (React)
points: Individual reflection flows
Acknowledgment of participation and trust
Experimental interface for non-material accounting

offline.title: Offline MVP (HTML / CSS / JS)
points: Group facilitation tool
Used in discussions, workshops, and pilot communities
Supports collective reflection without digital pressure

formats.note: Both versions are intentionally minimal and transparent.

how_used.title: How It Is Used Today
points: Facilitation instrument for small groups
Research tool for testing post-economic hypotheses
Prototype for ethical social-technology design
Discussion medium, not a behavioral controller

what_not.title: What the MVP Is Not
points: Not a social network
Not a DAO or token system
Not a reputation or scoring mechanism
Not a productivity or KPI tool
what_not.note: The MVP deliberately avoids mechanics that undermine trust or human dignity.

participate.title: How to Participate
points: Explore the source code on GitHub
Open an Issue with a question, idea, or use-case
Propose a pilot group or research scenario
Contribute to code, documentation, or translations
participate.note: This MVP evolves through dialogue, not through "growth hacking".

audience.title: Who This Is For
points: Researchers — testing post-economic models of value accounting
Developers — building ethical social-tech infrastructure
Practitioners — education, therapy, community facilitation
Systems thinkers — working with Noonomics as a living prototype
Philanthropists — supporting human-centered infrastructure outside politics

ethics.title: Ethical Filter
not_about: Monetization of attention or personal data
ethics.principle: Human dignity is higher than efficiency. Ethics is higher than technical optimization.

join.title: How to Join
points: Explore documentation and research
Open an Issue with an idea or use case
Propose a pilot group or scenario
Contribute to code, research, or translations
join.note: Pygmalion develops as an open research platform, not as a closed product.

final_cta.title: Build technology that amplifies humanity — not replaces it.

manifesto.title: Pygmalion Manifesto
manifesto.subtitle: Realization and Flourishing of Human Value beyond money, coercion, and KPI logic.
manifesto.p1: Human value exists beyond price, productivity, and performance metrics.
manifesto.p2: Participation must remain voluntary and meaningful, not enforced through incentives or penalties.
manifesto.p3: Recognition is not a reward, currency, or score — it is an ethical act.
manifesto.p4: Technology must reveal consequences of actions without controlling behavior.
manifesto.p5: No accumulation, speculation, ranking, or extraction of attention and data.
manifesto.p6: Human dignity has priority over efficiency, optimization, and growth logic.
manifesto.summary_body: Pygmalion / C.R.I.S.T.A.L.L. is an accounting-learning innovative NOD platform designed to explore post-economic forms of human value recognition. It enables the realization, acknowledgment, and flourishing of non-material human contributions such as care, trust, gratitude, and conscious participation. The platform deliberately avoids money, gamification, coercive mechanics, political alignment, and behavioral manipulation. Pygmalion functions as an open research environment and a living prototype for the 7th technological wave — Noonomics.
manifesto.boundary_body: Pygmalion is not a product for monetization, tokenization, political influence, or behavioral control. Any use that violates human dignity, voluntary participation, or ethical transparency is outside the scope of this project.
